body: Oops. Thanks for notifying

also requests :)

Done!
Done!

By the way, I just discover that you define 8088 in documentation

https://github.com/mistercrunch/panoramix/commit/fbc74244d4b92c243503e2375725676e64eb9b21

Did you install the trunk version of `pydruid` as specified in my [revised] installation instructions?

```
# I needed a feature added to pydruid, and it got merged into their 
# master branch but isn't on pypi yet, so you'll need the latest.
git clone https://github.com/metamx/pydruid.git
cd pydruid
python setup.py install
```

here's the related commit I wrote to add the feature (merged into master, but not on pypi):
https://github.com/metamx/pydruid/commit/97397d3ca84e1f9903752f04c06ad0375d5767c1
works for me now, thank you

So this message seems to point in the direction that you didn't install the dependencies.
`sudo pip install -r requirements.txt`

Hi @mistercrunch,
I was able to install everything and after doing "Refresh Metadata" I've loaded all data sources and dimensions.
Now Metrics are not automatically loaded so I've added some but every time I use it into the query I've this result (below) and Druid never receive any query:

```

Can you please explain how Metrics must be setup

Thanks
Maurizio

Metrics follow the druid aggregation documentation, using json. 
http://druid.io/docs/latest/querying/aggregations.html

You can also generate them dynamically from the columns checkboxes. If you check count_distinct, sum, ... on these columns, metrics will get generated the next time you click "Refresh Metadata". 

Though I'll push a PR with error handling around the json in there.

This should help:
https://github.com/mistercrunch/panoramix/pull/8
ok, it my python's problem, Flask is not installed in sys.path, and can not find it.

I think you may have skipped the installation part that goes
`pip install -r requirements.txt`

This should install all requirements including `flask`.

hi mistercrunch, i do run the pip command to install all requirements including flask, but all modules install in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages, and i add the path to python's sys.path and it works now.

```
export PYTHONPATH=/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages
```
Weird, normally `site-packages` is included in your Python path automatically, unless there are many python installs that don't play well together...

Here is my config.py file:

```

I tried to recreate your issue by upgrading to the latest version of Flask App Admin and wasn't able to.

Panoramix uses "Flask App Builder" for everything around authentication / permissions. Dropping in a "local_config.py" allows you to override the default `config.py` configuration. Please refer to the Flask App Builder docs for more info.
http://flask-appbuilder.readthedocs.org/en/latest/user_registration.html

Thanks for your help,the documentation really helped.
My setup was missing the RECAPTCHA keys,generated and added them.
Also created the admin user via the "fabmanager" command.
I'm not sure why I haven't hit the RECAPTCHA bug on my side... How are you creating the users?

I was trying to register user via the UI i.e by clicking on the Login tab on the right most corner and than clicking Register button.
After clicking the 'Register' the screen that pop ups for recording user credentials also have a RECAPTCHA verification and hence it need those RECAPTCHA keys.

My authentication type is AUTH_DB and i have default role for self registeration set to "Admin" i.e AUTH_USER_REGISTRATION_ROLE = "Admin"

Oh interesting. With the vanilla settings I've been using the `Menu -> Security -> List Users` and then clicking the `+` button to create users. I'm new to "Flask App Builder" though I'm coming from Django and Flask-Admin and I'm very happy with the design decisions behind "Flask App Builder". It seems like I can build a generic app and let the users define their authentication scheme.

Did you `sudo` to pip install or use a virtualenv? 

Can you try pointing your config's `SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI` to a sqlite on `/tmp`? I think if you sudo pip install the sqlite db ends up in a non writable location.

I'll change the default to `/tmp/panoramix.db` or `~/.panoramix` for the temporary sqlitedb
Awesome thanks!

Sorry, I've forgotten to add timezone to `granularity` of json, and I will test and pull again.

Thanks for your open project.

I notice the result of `query_obj` is not a json of query, maybe it does not support `json` in current version?

```
{'extras': {'where': ''},
 'filter': [(u'id', u'in', u'0')],
 'from_dttm': datetime.datetime(2015, 9, 8, 1, 34, 24),
 'granularity': 86400000.0,
 'groupby': [],
 'is_timeseries': True,
 'metrics': [u'sumcount'],
 'row_limit': 10,
 'timeseries_limit': 0,
 'to_dttm': datetime.datetime(2015, 9, 15, 1, 34, 24)
}
```

All of this is changing quite a bit in a branch I'm working on, expect the API to change quite a bite until it stabilizes.

Are you interested in getting an endpoint where you can get the Druid query json? I can make sure that this makes it in as a requirement.
This is grand.

LGTM!
![img](http://www.slate.com/content/dam/slate/blogs/xx_factor/2014/doughnut.jpg.CROP.promo-mediumlarge.jpg)
BTW I pushed to master a fix for the `False` attribution to checkboxes and all. The key was to build the URL using the `form_data` before it's digested by the form...

![img](http://i.imgur.com/Ichev.gif)
@akuhn , it's so easy to add a chart option now! I like how form_data is just available in the js

It looks like the dependency was missing in 0.4.0, it's ok in master. I'm getting ready to push 0.5.0 and there are tons of new features there. It should be mostly backwards compatible but maybe not 100%.
This looks very reasonable, let's babysit the app after we merge it
![img](https://media.giphy.com/media/WP1PJnXWQN692/giphy.gif)
Can you try with python2.7?
I added a note in the README about python version support. We're adding in python 3 support soon, no one should be using 2.6 anymore.
LGTM :+1:
It's not possible just yet, but I was thinking that we could add dataset metadata to pick between data time or local time or maybe specify an offset.

The endpoint it hits is essentially `http://{self.coordinator_host}:{self.coordinator_port}/{self.coordinator_endpoint}/datasources`

Do you have something there?
Fixed in current version
This should be fixed in the current version
ok.when I added the Coordinator Endpoint such as "druid/coordinator/v1" ,and now it works well .Thanks very much!
Nice. I'm adding some for sensible defaults to the form now.
Should I modify the panoramix code?Or How can I specify the offset.My all druid sources are ingesting with "Asia/Shanghai" timezone .Thanks!
I can add the feature this week. In the meantime you'll have to apply the offset in your head :)
down to 46 sec

bad endpoint for broker node, should be

```
{broker_host}:8082/druid/v2
```

The `since` input box expects either hard coded or intervals in human language ("1 day ago", "2015", "2015-04-01", "3 hours ago", ...). I use 2 libraries to do this and I'm guessing "-1" gets interpreted as "1AM of the current day", which isn't a bad guess.
thank you!  I use "9 hours ago ",it works well.

As discussed:
- clarify tooltip
- handle y2axis
@mistercrunch done
:astonished:
![img](https://media.giphy.com/media/UkhHIZ37IDRGo/giphy.gif)
Nice.

Some time I checked the query json, because we using druid without UTC timezone, query granularity like this:

```
{"type": "period", "period": "P1D", "timeZone": "America/Los_Angeles"}
```

We found granularity work not good when we setting "one day" in Time Granularity. So I want check and fix it.

http://flask-appbuilder.readthedocs.org/en/latest/

Repository health increased by 1% when pulling **[b0f7b3c](https://github.com/mistercrunch/panoramix/commit/b0f7b3c595ff467870acb751527c7e6c3cf295e6) on pivot_table** into **[5968344](https://github.com/mistercrunch/panoramix/commit/596834461332ee283484ab4c6d5412aab5f9df36) on master**.
- [9 new problems were found](https://landscape.io/diff/249570) (including 0 errors and 9 code smells).
- [8 problems were fixed](https://landscape.io/diff/249570/fixed) (including 0 errors and 8 code smells).
Good catch. I just pushed 0.6.1 addressing this. I'm renaming this task to related work that will prevent this.
@jamescasbon please confirm that 0.6.1 works for you
Yes, worksforme.  Thanks!
![img](https://media.giphy.com/media/fkD36jhiqzJ9m/giphy.gif)
That's nice, much more verbose. A bit redundant in places but overall much better!

yea, if we want to trim it down at some point, we def should, but this way there shouldn't be any ambiguity about what you're looking at
.
Awesome. I have to admit that I spent a good hour or so trying to fix this before without success... Good work!

Oh, so I don't want to add the specific DB reqs to the global `requirements.txt`, though the  `requirements.txt` is really just for reference since the actual dependencies for the package are out of `setup.py`. If I was to add the impala lib, I'd have to add the Oracle / MySQL / Postgres /... ones too potentially and most people have only a few they use in their environments, so it's for each person to install the lib they need depending on the connections they use...
Thanks for fixing this!
Yeah I made a huge amount of changes over the hackathon + break. We'll need solid unit tests covering all that JS. I've never done client-side unit tests so I need to figure it out.
Oh no! conflicts with yourself :/

Success!
![img](http://www.reactiongifs.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/forever-alone.gif)
Is that right? I thought you wanted the changes in `panoramix/static/panoramix.js` ? Maybe they got in as part of the other PR?

I think it is right. 

Before I was looping through and setting the z-index higher for the more left boxes. But now I don't need that b/c the one that you're hovering over comes all the way to the front. I tested it and no tool tips clip behind anything else anymore.
Perfect. Mergin'
I'm assuming you're referencing the "Time Series - Bar Chart"?
Precisely! :) what a rapid response

Should be done now. That was a one line change:
https://github.com/mistercrunch/panoramix/commit/4c8b275f8837b23dd1a606fac9d959addb458165#diff-51d3cdca5cf712763ee54c72935678c1R752
Thanks! That came in a blast! My favourit developer said he's waiting for the version to come as the nightly builds might be even less stable... any advices please? :)

ah, we've installed straight from the repository now, so we'll enjoy all the new features right away
the problem is that lots of views (except the table) seem to be broken now (separate issue opened)
what backend are you using?
Druid! :) always the best :)
Ok I pushed a fix in `master`

Yeah, the `m` for "micro" is confusing. The solution to that is using the d3 Y axis formatting in the form. It's not super intuitive but it's very flexible. Maybe I should have a free form dropdown with common suggestions instead of the current free form field:
Perfect. Maybe just make % the default for <1 values or something
Left some comments, but LGTM :+1:
Feature isn't complete yet, that was a first draft.

We only run the tests on `2.7` and `3.4`.

No one should be running `2.6` at this point.
Reopen if you see the issue on a supported version.
I like the approach !

I'm ok with the approach, can we just remove direct references to AirOlap and define a Druid semantic conf instead `DRUID_CONF`? Is hocon the best choice here? YAML and json are much more common. 

We should eventually document the feature, the docs are just getting started though.

Notes:
- I was able to install and get up and running without problems!
- many files have just been `mv`ed and should have been `git mv`ed to carry history and make a smaller PR, I think it's work fixing
- I like the new theme, though we should use matching Airbnb colors so that it doesn't clash as much with charts, maybe we can just pick the colors closer to the theme's in the Airbnb rainbow
- Some templates are unafected by the theme changes, I'll look into it as a way to get familiar with the changes
oh and looks like some of your commits aren't attached to your github id
after discussing with @mistercrunch, we will look at getting the metric definition from the segment metadata in the new druid release, closing this one

woot! let's hold off on merging this until the npm-ification is complete / dashboard + explore are back to working. 
- I agree re the airbnb colors, maybe we can play with a few in person. I have a customizable bootstrap repo locally we can modify / update from.
- thanks re github id, I think it's an issue with my ghe account
- we discussed theme mismatches + `git mv`s in person  

I'll look into merging your [PR](https://github.com/mistercrunch/panoramix/pull/141) now
